text: Karin Power (born 1982/83) is an American lawyer and Democratic politician currently serving in the Oregon House of Representatives. She represents the 41st district, which covers parts of Clackamas County and Multnomah County, including Milwaukie, Oak Grove, and parts of southeast Portland. ==Early Life and Education== Power moved to Southeast Portland from Boston, Massachusetts in 2009 in order to attend Lewis & Clark Law School. She later moved to Milwaukie in October 2012, and was elected to the City Council in 2014. == Political career == She won election to the House in 2016, defeating Republican candidate Timothy E. McMenamin with 71% of the vote. In 2018 she ran unopposed, receiving 97.1% of the vote, however turnout in this election was lower than previous elections. In 2020, she won the Democratic Primary unopposed with 99.32% of the vote (12,928). 88 individuals wrote in other names. In November, she will face Republican challenger and combat veteran Michael Newgard. ==Personal life== Power and her wife, Megan Elston, live in Milwaukie with their son, Grady. ==References== ==External links== * Campaign website * Legislative website Category:1980s births Category:Living people Category:Members of the Oregon House of Representatives Category:Oregon city council members Category:LGBT state legislators in Oregon Category:LGBT people from Massachusetts Category:Politicians from Boston Category:Oregon Democrats Category:People from Milwaukie, Oregon Category:21st-century American politicians Category:21st-century American women politicians Category:Women state legislators in Oregon Category:Lewis & Clark Law School alumni Category:Oregon lawyers Category:Lesbian politicians Category:Women city councillors in the United States
title: Karin Power
